page.title: 02River Ouse North Yorkshire
page.content: The river is tidal to Naburn lock and is bounded by ings land which is either grassland or high grade arable protected by earth flood defences. Flooding is frequent during the winter months and after heavy rainfall. Large areas of Grassland at the confluence of the Ouse and the Wharfe, and the village green bordering Stillingfleet beck are most affected.{ { It has frequent traffic, the majority {of vessels being pleasure craft. {Commercial traffic has been reduced to {the occasional loads of newsprint {being transported to York. { Members of the water_ski club based {at Cawood use the river, as do {anglers. Their catch includes chub, {eel,and "flatties".}
